entries.meaning: (grammar) The changing of the tense of a verb from present to past in reported speech.
(statistics) A function on a stochastic process whose value on any random variable is the preceding random variable in the process.

verbs.description: backshift (third-person singular simple present backshifts, present participle backshifting, simple past and past participle backshifted)

entries.meaning: (grammar, transitive) To change the tense of a verb from present to past in reported speech.
